text: Rear Admiral William John Yendell CB (1903–1988)Royal Navy (RN) Officers 1939-1945 - Y was a British Royal Navy officer. He was head of the naval mission to Greece up to its invasion by Axis forces, and after evacuation served as a staff officer in Alexandria until 1943. In October of that year until the closing months of World War II he commanded the escort carrier HMS Shah. After the war, apart from a few brief commands (HMS Glasgow, HMS Superb), he was based at the Admiralty becoming director of naval ordnance in 1951 and assistant chief of naval staff (warfare) in 1954, as well as naval ADC to Queen Elizabeth II. He retired in 1957. ==References== Category:1903 births Category:1988 deaths Category:Royal Navy admirals Category:Companions of the Order of the Bath Category:Royal Navy officers of World War II Category:People from Exeter
title: William John Yendell
